text: Yeah Thanks I've realised the problem. I have to manually filter the elements of the 4 by 4 matrix groups to get the subgroup I wanted.

text: hi, author of GAP.jl here. A 2x2 matrix group can't be a subgroup of a 4x4 matrix group.

text:
I don't know if people here use `GAP.jl`, but I have a question on it. I've let `D = GAP.Globals` for convenience but am running into this
```julia> D.IsSubgroup(<http://D.GL|D.GL>(4,3), <http://D.GL|D.GL>(2,3))
false```
Was wondering if anyone know what is going on. (x/posted to <#C66NPKCQZ|maths>)
